intro: Pentacalia andicola, commonly known as the Andean pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or volcanic soils, thriving in the cool, humid climates of the Andes. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Pentacalia andicola is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
